Great buy!

name: RockDove Men's Original Two-Tone Memory Foam Slipper
review: I gave a pair of these slippers to my husband for Christmas.His feet are slightly different sizes, with his left foot more or less fitting into a size 12 shoe while his right foot needs a size 13. Buying shoes or slippers has always been a frustrating trial for him.First off, these slippers come in larger sizes; so that was a homerun right off the bat.Still, I was uncertain what size to buy;so I measured the length of a pair of his shoes, compared that length to the given length of the slippers, and then bought the corresponding size, 13-14 US. I was afraid they might be too big, but thought "better a bit too big than too small".Well, he reports that the 13-14 fits him perfectly, and is wearing them daily. He no longer pads around the house in his socks.He likes that these slippers are easy to slip on and off, yet stay on his feet while he's walking.He likes that he can wear them with either thin or thick socks.He likes that, because of their thick, waterproof soles, he can step outside in them and his feet and socks will remain clean and dry, even if it has been raining or there is a bit of snow on the ground.What I like is that these slippers are attractive. He had bought himself a couple of pairs of what you might call "typical" men's slip-on slippers that were brown, more open and very thin soled. Apparently, they were the only things he could find, a few years back, that would fit his feet. They had gotten pretty ratty-looking, and a pair of ratty-looking size 12 slippers is not something that I enjoyed seeing lying about the house. So I admit that I was not seeking comfort in a slipper for him, but a higher esthetic. Happily, we can break out the party favors because these slippers have fulfilled both needs.These two-toned blue and Grey slippers are, so far, holding their shape. After two weeks of wear, they still look new. And, if a size 13-14 man's shoe can be "cute" these are. Seeing them in the front hall (where he leaves them when he goes out) bothers me not a whit.In short, these slippers are five star: warm, comfortable, useful, sturdy, attractive, and a perfect fit. My husband says this was the best present he's received in years.As he is a tough sell on most things, this is high praise. Warms the heart that I did something nice for the aging relative. I am, after all, quite fond of him.

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: These are nice warm slippers, made from all natural materials to allow your feet to breathe.The lining is wool- it is not sheep skin which I had expected as the title is "Nordvek Mens Genuine Suede Sheepskin Wool Lined"- the suede is from a sheep- hence the sheepskin, it is not a sheepskin lining like that in Ugg boots etc.Having set that straight the slippers themselves are good quality, they have no sole, it is a slipper that is in two pieces, the foot glove and the top which is stitched in, so it is all suede and can not be worn outside the house ( no popping out to put something into the bin in these).The fit is true to size and they stay on the foot instead of your foot slipping around in them and the slipper coming off, this means that they are fine to wear going up and down stairs.The suede is nice and soft and these slippers are very comfortable and will no doubt soften even more with wear making them better still.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2015

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: I normally go for 9 1/2 so ordered size 10. Initially the fit seemed rather narrow but the nature of the material proved pretty stretchy and the fit became comfortable in a very short time. I think that size 11 would be a little loose fitting for me.  Quality of finish seems very good and service from this seller and the prompt delivery of the item can be commended
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 October 2019

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: I have been looking for suede slippers without soles for many years, so I am very pleased I have now found a supplier, thank you. I have found them to be well made and very comfortable. I took other reveiws recommendations to buy a size larger and found the slippers to fit snugly.Overall I am very pleased with the slippers with one comment that the labels fitted to the underside were extremely difficult to remove, so maybe labelling should be done differently.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 June 2018

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: Although happy with this product as to fit and comfort we were very upset to discover that, after one evenings wear only, the navy dye from the slippers leached out strongly into our pale beige carpet. It took considerable treatment to remove this dye and the cleaning treatment( using a well known carpet cleaner) has leached colour out of the carpet and basically ruined a brand new ¬£900 carpet only laid 3 weeks previously. What adds to the distress is that there was no warning on the packaging or invoice that dark colours might bleed out. We shall be contacting the manufacturers about this issue. Additional: Have had very decent feedback from the company 'Maddog retail Ltd'. who have apologised and refunded cost and offered funds towards cleaning the carpet. There was no colour bleed warning, as this problem has not happened before.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2020

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: These slippers are ideal for me because I needed some with a non rubber sole because my wife and daughter are allergic to rubber. These slippers filled the requirement, fitted perfectly and are comfortable with a fleece lining which keeps the feet warm and snug. They have laces which can be used to adjust the fit slightly although I find they come undone every so often but my previous similar slippers also did this, not a big problem but something to be aware of. All in all I highly recommend these slippers.

I think that size 11 would be a little loose fitting for me.  Quality of finish seems very good and service from this seller and the prompt delivery of the item can be commended
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 October 2019

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: I have been looking for suede slippers without soles for many years, so I am very pleased I have now found a supplier, thank you. I have found them to be well made and very comfortable. I took other reveiws recommendations to buy a size larger and found the slippers to fit snugly.Overall I am very pleased with the slippers with one comment that the labels fitted to the underside were extremely difficult to remove, so maybe labelling should be done differently.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 June 2018

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: Although happy with this product as to fit and comfort we were very upset to discover that, after one evenings wear only, the navy dye from the slippers leached out strongly into our pale beige carpet. It took considerable treatment to remove this dye and the cleaning treatment( using a well known carpet cleaner) has leached colour out of the carpet and basically ruined a brand new ¬£900 carpet only laid 3 weeks previously. What adds to the distress is that there was no warning on the packaging or invoice that dark colours might bleed out. We shall be contacting the manufacturers about this issue. Additional: Have had very decent feedback from the company 'Maddog retail Ltd'. who have apologised and refunded cost and offered funds towards cleaning the carpet. There was no colour bleed warning, as this problem has not happened before.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2020

name: Nordvek Mens Sheepskin Moccasin - Soft Suede Sole - Wool Lined Slippers # 423-100
review: These slippers are ideal for me because I needed some with a non rubber sole because my wife and daughter are allergic to rubber. These slippers filled the requirement, fitted perfectly and are comfortable with a fleece lining which keeps the feet warm and snug. They have laces which can be used to adjust the fit slightly although I find they come undone every so often but my previous similar slippers also did this, not a big problem but something to be aware of. All in all I highly recommend these slippers.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 November 2014

name: Under Armour Surge 3 Mens Running Shoes
review: I bought these as a punt. I saw the price and knew that it would be very difficult to find a proper running shoe for under ¬£100 / $150 (actually for running). The inner cushioning is okay 7/10. Not as good as my actual running shoes made by Puma. The outer is much stiffer 6/10. So, what are you buying these for? If you want running shoes, buy an actual pair of good high technology running shoes, and expect to pay 3 times this easily. You wont injure yourself with good proper runners gear. Your knees wont hurt as much from every impact, and you will be less likely to get shin splints. You will be more likely to actually get fit, because you won't stop from daily aches and occasional hard impact injuries. But ... If you want comfortable shoes for daily urban walks, these are fantastic. The price is amazing for just comfortable daily non-running workouts.
